link.description: Blockchain indexers are specialized systems that collect, organize, and make blockchain data easily accessible for applications and users. Since raw blockchain data is stored in a decentralized, append-only ledger, querying it directly can be slow and resource-intensive. Indexers solve this by continuously scanning blocks, transactions, and events, then structuring that information in optimized databases that support fast lookups and complex queries. This allows developers to build user-friendly interfaces, analytics dashboards, wallets, and decentralized applications (dApps) without manually parsing low-level blockchain data. In short, blockchain indexers act as the bridge between complex blockchain records and practical, real-world applications.
